net.proteusframework.cms.component.generator

Class XMLGenerator<T extends ContentElement>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.cms.component.generator.GeneratorImpl<T>
      • net.proteusframework.cms.component.generator.XMLGenerator<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type parameter.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cacheable<T>, Generator<T>, Renderer<T>

    public class XMLGenerator<T extends ContentElement>
extends GeneratorImpl<T>
    Simple generator that returns content that is XML fragment. Automatically includes a Link Tag Listener and an Object Tag Listener.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

        public XMLGenerator(ContentType type)

      • XMLGenerator

        public XMLGenerator(ContentType type,
            Collection<? extends Enum> purposes)
        Creates a new instance. Uses only those purposes included.
        Parameters:
        type - the content type. One of Xml, XHtml, and Html (xhtml actually).
        purposes - a set of Model Data purpose(s) to use.

      • addTagListener

        public boolean addTagListener(net.proteusframework.internet.http.RequestResponseTagListener tl)
        Add a tag listener. The argument will replace all tag listeners that are listening for tag that the argument supports. It is possible for the argument to replace more than one listener.
        Parameters:
        tl - the tag listener.
        Returns:
        true if the add operation removed an existing RequestResponseTagListener.

      • getDataSourceTimestamp

        public long getDataSourceTimestamp(CmsRequest<T> request)
        Description copied from class: GeneratorImpl
        Get the latest timestamp of the data being used to generate the content. The timestamp should be for the content being generated by the generator. The timestamp should not represent data from other elements in the process chain with the exception of delegates not processed by CMS. This method is guaranteed to be called for every CMS (http / servlet) request.

        Returns the last modified time of the PageElement.

        Specified by:
        getDataSourceTimestamp in interface Generator<T extends ContentElement>
        Overrides:
        getDataSourceTimestamp in class GeneratorImpl<T extends ContentElement>
        Parameters:
        request - the request.
        Returns:
        the timestamp or -1 if unknown.

      • getExpireInterval

        public long getExpireInterval()
        Get the expire interval.
        Returns:
        the expire interval.

      • getExpireTime

        public long getExpireTime()
        Description copied from class: GeneratorImpl
        Get the expire time of the generated content. This method must never return a negative value. Content generators must always specify a valid expire time.

        A default is used if the expire time is set to Integer.MIN_VALUE or unset. The default is based on the value returned by HTMLPageElementUtil.getExpireTime(PageElement, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit, long) with the last two parameters being TimeUnit.HOURS and 4. The default can only be calculated if subclasses call one of these methods: GeneratorImpl.getIdentity(CmsRequest), GeneratorImpl.getDataSourceTimestamp(CmsRequest), GeneratorImpl.preRenderProcess(CmsRequest, CmsResponse, ProcessChain), or GeneratorImpl.calculateDefaultExpireTime(CmsRequest).

        Specified by:
        getExpireTime in interface Cacheable<T extends ContentElement>
        Specified by:
        getExpireTime in interface Generator<T extends ContentElement>
        Overrides:
        getExpireTime in class GeneratorImpl<T extends ContentElement>
        Returns:
        the expire time in millis or 0 if it expires immediately. Return -1 to indicate that the expire time from this Cacheable shouldn't be used unless otherwise specified.

      • getNDEs

        public List<net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource.html.NDE> getNDEs()
        Description copied from interface: Renderer
        Get the NDEs needed by the generated content.

        The NDEs should be assembled in the preRenderProcess method. See the class level javadoc for order of method calls. The ProcessChain will gather the NDEs of any Renderers or PageElements that are delegated to.

        Specified by:
        getNDEs in interface Renderer<T extends ContentElement>
        Overrides:
        getNDEs in class GeneratorImpl<T extends ContentElement>
        Returns:
        the NDEs.

      • preRenderProcess

        public void preRenderProcess(CmsRequest<T> request,
                    CmsResponse response,
                    ProcessChain chain)
        Description copied from class: GeneratorImpl
        Process the request. Smart implementations should check to see if anything needs to be done before doing any work.

        This implementation doesn't process child elements. If your implementation requires that functionality, override.

        Specified by:
        preRenderProcess in interface Renderer<T extends ContentElement>
        Overrides:
        preRenderProcess in class GeneratorImpl<T extends ContentElement>
        Parameters:
        request - the request.
        response - the response.
        chain - the process chain.

      • setExpireInterval

        public void setExpireInterval(long expireInterval)

      • setProcessor

        public void setProcessor(XMLRenderer.Processor processor)
        Set the processor. This can be used to provide a way to process a request without extending or implementing a generator for every bean. Must be called after setRenderer(XMLRenderer).
        Parameters:
        processor - the processor.

      • setRenderer

        public void setRenderer(XMLRenderer<T> renderer)
        Set the renderer. This can be used to provide a way to process a request without extending or implementing a generator for every bean.
        Parameters:
        renderer - the renderer.
